8 million gift to establish the Randy Boyd School of Hospitality and Tourism Management within the Haslam College of Business at the University of Tennessee, the university announced Monday.
The new school will be one of the first in the country to offer a comprehensive hospitality and tourism management program that combines business acumen with industry expertise.
The gift is the largest ever made to the Haslam College of Business.
The gift is part of UT's Volunteer State of Mind capital campaign, which aims to raise $1 billion by 2019.
It will also be one of the largest endowed gifts in UT’s history.
The program aims to prepare students for leadership roles in the global hospitality and tourism industries.
The gift from the Boyds is the largest donation ever made to the Haslam College of Business.
"I am thrilled that Randy and Jenny have chosen to invest in the University of Tennessee and the state's growing hospitality and tourism industries," said UT Chancellor Donde Plowman. "

"We're thrilled to support the University of Tennessee and the state's growing hospitality and tourism industry," said Randy Boyd, chairman of Boyd Sports LLC, owner of the Tennessee Smokies minor league baseball team and founder of Radio Systems Corporation. "
The Randy Boyd School of Hospitality and Tourism Management will offer undergraduate and graduate degree programs, as well as certificate programs and professional development opportunities.
"This gift from Randy and Jenny Boyd is truly transformative for our college and for the state of Tennessee," said Steve Mangum, dean of the Haslam College of Business. "
It allows us to create a premier institution for hospitality and tourism education, which will have a direct impact on the state's economy."

We're proud to partner with the University of Tennessee to make this vision a reality."
